title: Fix the 'Chicken Wing' (Elbow Flare)
author: adam-harrington
description: The #1 mechanical flaw in youth shooting. Fix the flaring elbow to straighten your shot path and increase accuracy.
coachNote: Adam's Take: Your elbow points where the ball goes. If it points right, you miss right. We fix this by shooting 'one-handed form' close to a wall. The wall doesn't lie—it gives you instant feedback that no coach can replicate.

steps.title: Wall Shooting (Form)
steps.instruction: Stand 6 inches from a wall with your shooting side facing it. Practice your shooting motion—if your elbow flares, you'll hit the wall. The wall forces the tuck.

steps.title: The Guide Hand Shadow
steps.instruction: Shadow shoot without a ball. Focus ONLY on your elbow staying under your wrist throughout the entire motion. Freeze at the top of your release and check your elbow position.

steps.title: One-Hand Form Shooting
steps.instruction: Close range, one hand only (no guide hand). Shoot 10 reps focusing on keeping your elbow pointed at the rim. No guide hand = pure shooting mechanics.

steps.title: Feet Position Check
steps.instruction: Turn your feet 10-15 degrees toward your shooting side (right-handers turn slightly right). This naturally aligns your hip and shoulder, reducing elbow flare.

coachingCues: Elbow should be under the ball, not beside it
Your shooting hand index finger should be in the CENTER of the ball
A slight foot turn (10-15 degrees) is legal and helps alignment
Check your guide hand—if the thumb is pushing, the elbow will flare
commonMistake: Keeping feet perfectly square to the basket
mistakeFix: Turn your lead foot 10-15 degrees toward your shooting hand side. This opens your hip and naturally brings the elbow in.
